metadata.title: CVE-2009-0166 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The JBIG2 decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, and other products allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file that triggers a free of uninitialized memory.

notes.note: kees> this is also CVE-2009-0146, CVE-2009-0147, but not CVE-2009-0165. http://idisk.mac.com/drew_yao-Public/jbig2.zip mdeslaur> our cups uses the system pdftops, so we're not affected jdstrand> CUPS compiled with --disable-pdftops sbeattie> ipe uses system pdflatex

criterions.comment: libextractor package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
poppler package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
xpdf package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
